message.content:
cs.DB, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with the problem of mining frequent itemsets, which is a classic problem in data mining and falls under the category of database systems (cs.DB). The use of sampling for efficient mining of frequent itemsets is a common technique in data mining and falls under the category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The paper also proposes an approximation algorithm for the top-K frequent itemsets, which involves estimating the frequencies of itemsets with bounded error, and this falls under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also discusses the use of Bloom filters, which is a probabilistic data structure used in information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the paper presents experimental results on both synthetic and real datasets, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG).
